article_title: FAA Releases Initial Roadmap for Drone Use
article_text:
Federal aviation regulators released their first overall plan to eventually integrate drones into U.S. airspace, but they riled critics seeking greater attention to privacy protections.

The Federal Aviation Administration on Thursday laid out nearly 100 pages of specific technical and procedural principles intended to ensure safe design and operation of domestic drones—an early step toward what proponents project could be routine...

twitter.description: Federal aviation regulators, emphasizing the "significant challenges" of integrating remotely piloted drone aircraft into domestic airspace, released their initial regulatory roadmap for safety, operational and privacy safeguards to reach that goal.
twitter.title: Drone Plan Draws Privacy Concerns

image.alt: FAA releases an initial roadmap for integrating drones into U.S. airspace.

twitter.creator: @jacknicas
